title: Brown ooze
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

*For a list of all jellies, see [list of jellies](/List_of_jellies "List of jellies").*

| brown ooze J [![Brown ooze.png](/images/5/50/Brown_ooze.png)](/File:Brown_ooze.png) |                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [HP](/Hit_points "Hit points")                                                      | 25-51                                                                                                                                                                                                 |

| [Resistances](/Resistance "Resistance")                                             | [rPois+](/Poison "Poison"), [rAcid+++](/Acid "Acid"), [rConstr](/Constriction "Constriction"), [rWater](/Category:Water_resistance "Category:Water resistance"), [Asphyx](/Resistances "Resistances") |
| [Vulnerabilities](/Vulnerability "Vulnerability")                                   | None                                                                                                                                                                                                  |

|   |                                                                                                |
| - | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A viscous liquid being that flows along the floor in search of matter to dissolve and consume. |

## Useful Info

**Brown oozes** are nasty, corrosive monsters that should be handled with caution. Effectively a beefier [jelly](/Jelly "Jelly"), they devour items to heal and reproduce, deal significant [acid](/Acid "Acid") damage with their attacks, and can corrode your equipment. They can be found in or guarding [the Slime Pits](/The_Slime_Pits "The Slime Pits").

## Tips & Tricks

By the time you encounter them, you should have the means for taking them out safely. Fill as many armour slots as possible to reduce acid damage (especially [cloaks](/Cloak "Cloak")), have [preservation](/Preservation "Preservation") or an [amulet of resist corrosion](/Amulet_of_resist_corrosion "Amulet of resist corrosion") to protect your insufficiently enchanted gear, and above all else try to kill them at a distance with spells, *not* ammunition which they can eat.

## History

Brown oozes were removed in [0.15](/0.15 "0.15").

Brown ooze

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.

For a list of all jellies, see list of jellies.

brown ooze J 
HP 25-51
HD 7
XP 245
Speed 10
AC 10
EV 1
Will 65
Attack1 25 (hit: acid: 7d3)


Resistances rPois+, rAcid+++,
rConstr, rWater,
Asphyx
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Plant
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Natural
Size Little
Type jelly, brown ooze
Flags Eats items
Acidic flesh
Sense invisible
A viscous liquid being that flows along the floor in search of matter to dissolve and consume.

Useful Info

Brown oozes are nasty, corrosive monsters that should be handled with caution. Effectively a beefier jelly, they devour items to heal and reproduce, deal significant acid damage with their attacks, and can corrode your equipment. They can be found in or guarding the Slime Pits.

Tips & Tricks

By the time you encounter them, you should have the means for taking them out safely. Fill as many armour slots as possible to reduce acid damage (especially cloaks), have preservation or an amulet of resist corrosion to protect your insufficiently enchanted gear, and above all else try to kill them at a distance with spells, not ammunition which they can eat.

History

Brown oozes were removed in 0.15.
